VVtAc5rlDrskeqfmxEpb3w.text: Negative  1. Overcrowded and a bit fuzzy . We needed to change our glasses as they were smelly 2. Pizza is definitely not italian, by a long shot. More like a cheap UK version from Tesco.  Food all together was ok, but no WOW factor

uLAAKm45ZTUvEB2LTWAmyQ.text: The restaurant is really nice and warm place. Cheap and good quality Italian food. Service is perfect and really fast.

ok2fmtu8pKg1O2MLTgbopQ.text: Staff are very understanding and friendly, but I've been there now three times and everytime something was wrong with either the order or the food. Although the problems were minor and eventually resolved, it does make me feel this place is not worth more than three stars. I also find that the menu options for vegetarians/vegans are limited which is a real shame. Oh, if you order Tiramisu for dessert, then you're one lucky person if you actually end up with it. Out of the three times I've been, twice they'd run out of Tiramisu!! Finally please be aware that this restaurant gets very busy and on the weekend there's usually a queue. It pays to book a table!

AjvdaSN2WzoARp_ES9AuKw.text: Excellent Italian Restaurant. Service very good and food is lovely. We did have to send back a meal which wasnt as hot as we'd liked but staff very understanding. Great for taking kids, very child friendly

EC1RNDYNIowWvYLpkMu7Sg.text: Bella Italia is a chain Italian restaurant with various locations around Edinburgh.  This one on North Bridge seems to always be packed, I guess it attracts the tourists. The restaurant itself is nice enough while attempting to maintain authenticity. The staff are usually nice but the service can be a little slow due to how busy it is. But everything just seems a little bland and boring, as it is just another chain restaurant. It lacks the charm that those authentic little Italian restaurants have. The menu offers your standard Italian food, and if you look online you can usually find money off vouchers. Hence my reason for ever going. I usually end up getting a panini or burger, I know that isn't exactly Italian but looking at my dining partners pasta I have never been too impressed. And I like chips.   I will say that their "Godfather" dessert is pretty good. I am a sucker for fatty, chocolatey, ice-creamy desserts that come in big bowls and that does just that.   I would probably give this place a miss and head to one of the more authentic Italian restaurants because the food will be miles better.

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

jZdmR-RjAAJTuTBuSa80Cw.text: Popped in for some lunch. Service was quick, however my girlfriends Carbonara was a bit bland. Risotto was lovely. Would probably try somewhere else, more local to the area next time we visit.

kYws6P7XuHQy76RmCRCadQ.text: Went out with my wife on our honeymoon to scotland fiending for desert and this was the first place we ended up here by coincidence. Unfortunately,  it went down hill from the start. Upon being seated we were told that they were out of salmon, lamb, and spinach asbwell as one of they baeses to a desert. Then we noticed a confrontation between a member of the waitstaff and a disgruntled customer. I am not sure what had happened but it was enough to rattle the customers nearby and my wife, who was opposite me on the other side of the bar area. Next, I had ordered a gin and tonic and it was all tonic with about 4 ice cubes in a glass a bit bigger than a highball glass . The last straw was when we got the desert. I had ordered their desert shooters wanting something sweet. I had the banana coffee which was really good, the tiramisu and the cheesecake. I had finished the banana one, went half way through the tiamisu and decided to try the cheesecake. The cheesecake had not had a chance to set and was runny which was really dissappointing. I went back to the tiramisu and the NEXT BITE HIT A PIECE OF PLASTIC! I told our waiter and he brought the manager over and he apologized and offered us something else. I didnt want to take my chances so I asked for the check. He said he would comp our deserts and when the check came he only took mime off.... I just paid and left. They waiter we had said that they were closing in a few days for a remodel but I feel like they dont care about their quality and customers why would you go back?

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Piece of plastic is found in my Tirimisu shooter, next to the runny cheesecake shooter.

PhbXzP2622QXgARE3Hjn0Q.text: Really exceeded expectations, plenty of choice on the menu, upstairs seating, and the quality of the food is a lot better than some other well known Italian food chains I have been to, I would definitely return

-PcpMiQDu-XlyvQ8At1Ijw.text: When I stayed in Edinburgh we had a meal at Bella Italia. I have been to Bella Italia before and thought it was mediocre but this time I thought it was a bit better. Service was great and food was really nice and seemed high quality-last time I ate there it just seemed really average for the price. I was pleased with the one I had it Edinburgh and it made me like the chain a little more. Also the restaurant itself was really nice inside, I like the decor and music.

s4NUy7t0CSTQxDJNCEzCJQ.text: Came here for lunch. The pasta dishes were done perfectly and their special ricci pasta, made specially for the restaurant, was the perfect pasta to pick up and hold all the wonderful flavors in the sauces!  Service was good. Interior was bistro looking. Nice!

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pasta with Chicken and spicy marinara sauce (Arribanato sp?)
Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pasta with Chicken, pesto, mushrooms
Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Restaurant exterior

r_qy8YWZryB36LEes2Q5nQ.text: Had a delightful end of day meal here following site seeing in Central Edinburgh-glad we found it on yelp! Great salmon salad & yummy bread-calimare was worth the order too!

RAfY8H56toNM1JzAQRHX4w.text: I've already reviewed another branch of Bella Italia, and while I'm loath to reference a previous review in my musings on this branch, it's perhaps quite telling about Bella Italia as a whole that I really can't think of anything else they do worth commenting on.  Decent but dreary Italian food "jus like-a mamma use-da make eh", assuming your mamma is a 20 stone welder from Pilton, you know exactly what to expect from here.  What you won't expect though, is penne with duck, spring onions and plum sauce. I'm assured it's fantastic, but I've never been brave enough to try the most bizarre food combination I've seen since Asda did Ninja Turtles branded chocloate and marshmallow pizza.

aSepW9i1eyViWY1scsYuAg.text: Bella Italia is a reasonably good chain of Italian restaurants which you'll find dotted around big cities like Glasgow and here in Edinburgh.  One thing you can say about Bella is that it is usually busy and the staff are more than accommodating. We visited on a bank holiday and the place was packed, but the waitress went out of her way to move a table for two for us and seat us in less than ten minutes which was really nice.  This restaurant is a chain, so don't expect anything out of the ordinary or anything too authentic. It kind of reminds me of Frankie and Bennys or DiMaggio's which kind of leave me a bit deflated, although I will say that Bella Italia is one of the better chains I have visited.  I had spaghetti Gamberi (which to me and you is spaghetti with prawns, tomato, chili and garlic) I usually get this in every Italian I go to so I'm quite a good judge of it, and I have to say this was one of the nicer ones I have had! My friend went for lasagne which looked very nice, and I tried a wee sneaky bit. It was lovely too!  The bill for two with wine came to just under 30 which was pretty good going. I was impressed and would certainly go there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

CeFJwPs2EpyXmv8TosKlFA.text: Highly recommended although the staff not very friendly. Good food and reasonable price: rucula salad with parmesan is delicious. We were welcomed by a polite, smiling and GORGEOUS waiter ... so, I would like to return again ! lol

aI4or194ngKbmYaMiPI8iA.text: This is a good place if you can't be bothered cooking. It's a very unpretentious, no fuss, nice but not fancy, restaurant.   The food is nothing special- the garlic bread is dry and you get the impression a lot of it is heated in a microwave, but this is reflecte din the prices and laid back atmosphere- it's very fmaily friendly.

3db6jXdY0FwIOrHgPd553g.text: The Bella Italia restaurant chain is efficient in carrying out its services to you; quickly providing you with large quantities of filling Italian-style food.   Some of the pizzas are quite nice, but I couldn't eat a whole one.

GVFrBedvx9lxYvAnmuzkEg.text: A nice place with a good selection but I feel they could do with updating their menu more often. Go here with your Tesco vouchers and it makes it a bargain!

E-75CaRKWetb97-9G55mQQ.text: We were looking for lunch and our little girls were asking for pizza. The pizza hut on Cockburn Street and Pizza Paradise on North Bridge were both closed on the Sunday after Christmas, so our options were limited. It worked to our advantage. Located at the intersection with High Street about halfway between Edinburgh Castle and Holyrood Palace, it is an excellent stopping point if you are making a day of walking the 'Royal Mile'   Our family of 5 was taken in immediately and given a seating area where there was space for our pram as well as a high chair. The children were given place mats to color on and do activities.   Two of the girls shared the pizza meal off the children's menu. This came with vanilla ice cream and when they served it each child received a full portion. They were elated and took all the time they needed to finish it off.   My wife and I shared a Bruschetta and then a vegetarian pizza with all the fixings. The glass of Pinot Griggio washed it all down very nicely. Our window seats gave us the opportunity to people watch in between tending to the children.   I really enjoyed the way the server did not rush us. He gave us the time we needed to get through each stage of our meal. With three young children we tend to move at a different pace. The one down side is the location of the toilet rooms-located 1 1/2 stories down. It makes it a bit difficult with small children, especially babies.

M-PbNOk87NNBEd7rCxufnA.text: Got a great deal for a 3course meal for a reasonable amount. Quick service and tasty food.

a2HFa6dh6_ABZCj8Kjpwwg.text: This is a very nice italian restaurant.I visited this restaurant several times while visiting Edinburgh. You can enjoy warm and friendly atmosphere there.   Their food is really quality and delicious. They offer a good variety of different kinds of food. But I think they had better change their menu or add something new.Their prices are fairly resonable.   Service is perfect and very fast. Staff are polite and friendly.They are always ready to solve any problem.   You can use your Tesco's vouchers there   It is very suitable place to have meal with your children. But sometimes this restaurant is very busy and you need to wait for a table for a while.

PSesbBUky_kxtJ1kuut1Tg.text: The food here is very good value for money with a wide variety of traditional Italian dishes on offer together with some less known courses.  The atmosphere was pleasant and the staff were helpful. We arrived quite early & by the time we left it was really filling up so booking in advance is recommended. A thouroughly enjoyable evening.

utavrz8LkMX0ENdgzst1iQ.text: The food was average (not hard when cooking pasta!) but the waiting staff ruined our visit entirely. Our waiter was rude and ignorant. It was difficult to get any service from him, I was pressured to give a tip, and when (unsurprisingly) I chose not to tip I received verbal abuse as I left!   Disgusted and I won't be back. There are plenty other Italian restaurants in Edinburgh that are more welcoming and/or have better food.

S-cx8p5uoqwqgodlMiRhEQ.text: Great place for a nice meal , food is generally very good quality but can be a bit slow at times but given it's location can't complain. Can get very busy with people waiting on tables to be vacated but overal great food , only flaw was no draught lager when i was there. Has good lunchtime deals on meals.

auLG-bRQEN_9ORvozomO0Q.text: A three course meal for two will cost you about 50 pounds, but rest assured those pounds will be well spent. The food here has everything that makes a meal special: flavour, aroma and presentation (good portions too!).

_6hgYH2HDK5xGLin5c-IdA.text: The staff manager Mr. Lee was extremely rude, offensive and outrightly racist. Our server, Ms. Engrid, didn't serve any water to us on our arrival and even after finishing our starters and half way through our entrees, when my wife asked for water she didn't serve it while she served another table water immediately on the arrival. When we tried to ask her repeatedly for water that Mr. Lee came to our table and in a threatening voice said, she is working hard and will get us the water when she will be able to get to it. His tone was like he is doing charity on us by providing water. When my wife told him that he needs to serve people with same attitude irrespective of the skin of the color. He shouted 'You be careful' in a loud intimidating voice like threatening to physically harm us. We had to leave the restaurant after paying without completing our meals as we were so disgusted with the behavior of the staff in such a cosmopolitan tourist area where you can find people from all walks of life. We have travelled to 45 countries including Italy but have never felt threatened while eating in an establishment by the serving staff. It was totally unacceptable and we will never recommend anyone to 'Bella Italia' chain of restaurants.  Please boycott such a racist restaurant chain.

xUF5QWuqpYlHuoXnEwLJgA.text: I had a very nice lunch here. It was chicken salad with delicious chicken. The staff were very friendly, and my waiter was gorgeous. He made me wish I was about 30 years younger.

vKcbG0rP2YZABuXoYmq1Aw.text: Great location for people watching along Royal Mile. Homemade pasta was delicious and my husband really liked his calzone too.

2A00ljXCYyqrxGmJOcdccA.text: Service/hospitality is the first (in fact the most important) factor I consider before rating a restaurant. I must say Bella Italia sucks big time in that department. We were there for an early dinner and it took them about 15 mins to get us seated. No biggie right, considering the tourist rush in Edinburgh. Wait till you read further.  We were in a bit of a rush, so when the host arrived to take our order,  we asked him what their turn around time was after an order has been placed. When he said that it's gonna take around 25 - 30 mins, we inquired politely if there was anyway to expedite. We were about to ask if there are items on the menu that might take less preparation time, when he cut us off with the most absurdly arrogant statement I ever heard from a server "This is a restaurant and not a fast food joint. It is going to take that time (Not to mention the attitude he was sporting on his face while uttering this)". It took my wife and I(Unanimously) all about 2 secs to get up and leave the place after hearing that. I am still unable to believe the kind of arrogance this man showed and the negligence that this business carries towards their patrons. If I am ever back in Edinburgh, I will make sure to NOT visit this place again - EVER!  Folks at Bella Italia - Remember, you are not running a charity here. People pay for your service and the survival of your business lies entirely at the mercy of your patrons. Enough with the attitude already.

9kIEBK9yuaA0Z7iClifnrg.text: We usually avoid food places on the tourist strips.  But we are glad we stopped here. The pizza as wonderful. The spaghetti was perfect. The chicken salad was another hit.   Easy access. Good service. Fairly priced for being on the Royal mile.

gXeoxN1FPZC4ElLPora4eQ.text: The food was delicious . However we were seated right by the steps where a lot of workers liked to put their rear end near my husbands shoulder.  Sitting almost on the next guest!   If you are directed to that 2 person table by the steps...... decline it!!!

l5ljut2gEltc-8gJA_0ywQ.text: Pizza was great.  Ordered the Margarita pizza with extra basic and the waiter delivered.  Very friendly staff.  My husband order ravioli and he said it's okay.  But the lava cake (pizzooki) was to die for.  Nice ambiance too.

gguc7D5ZNozjD6F2MKz_xw.text: guilt city  someone please tell me this isn't a foreign chain and is owned by local peeps. When ever I am here I take almost all my meals here. I can't help it the food is really really friggin good. I also love people watching by the window

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

Jo1Vz50Wwl-Uo2niXyd5oA.text: This place was open late when others were closing up for night. And with two little ones in toe we thought this was our only option for a late dinner.  What a great surprise. Kids got fresh homemade soda...quite good. We got beer and cocktails which were nice.  Kids had pasta and ribs, both of which they finished so much have been good.  I had the Carbonara pasta, which I have to say I am a very highly critical off...it was okay, which is not bad....again highly critical...my point of comparison is a mom and pop Resturant in Italia where a grandmother made it for me....not fair but this is life.  Wife had a sausage Stromboli....she was quite impressed and finished it all to my surprise. Overall night recommend, service was pretty good, noting the place was packed with folks waiting for a table at 10:30pm. If you in area and want a good spot...this is am option for sure!

6UgMuUcEbkKi-yeOMdNOAw.text: Not really sure on how to best describe this restaurant. It's very basic, nothing unique about it if you would compare it to other Italian restaurants. The services was great (basically the majority of the rating was because of the service). The man who served us was very kind and generous and couldn't have done a better job.  Food :- A friend had ordered for me as I was getting ready in the hotel room so by the time I arrived it was slightly cold, the waiter offered to heat it up for me, which he did. Upon tasting the food the mushrooms were slightly burnt - the chicken was fine and nothing special. The potatoes tasted as if someone had thrown a heap of salt on them which wasn't that good.  Quite hard to judge this restaurant as I was pretty jet lagged and very hungry!! So I will probably give it another chance before I leave.

wiX076vbuVc5bqyP8IKM3A.text: Family-friendly, serves food late, and the pasta/pizza/garlic bread is delicious. Our kids loved there food, and the location is handy, too.

dpTP4YDYDGBs7qBL6sQt6w.text: We went here for lunch..this isn't even authentic Italian! The bruschetta was basically just tomatoes and onions, no Balsamic, herbs, garlic, or perhaps not even pepper. The main course cannelloni was uninventive and tasted just like the kind that you buy in the store...no flavour as well. (very basic) The decor was very stereotypical. The only redeeming quality was that the waiter was polite, but that's expected. Try something local or go to another Italian restaurant in town, or for half the price, buy a frozen lasagna at Tesco, heat it up in your microwave and it will taste just the same!

4DCgccoFLHib1v5vOUbn5g.text: we ordered the turkey, sirloin steak and the chicken breast and waited over one hour. It was a terrible experience. The turkey was so dry tasted like fabric, I felt like I was chewing my sweater. And the chicken breast was also very dry and I am pretty sure they literally used a entire bottle of salt. The steak was suppose to be medium and it looked and tasted like it was well done.

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Turkey

w-hI-f4pV00sr0rZcazgNw.text: We had wonderful breakfast and coffee here two mornings in a row!  It was close to our hotel and the prices were great, staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  Food was delicious!  We did a traditional scottish breakfast and a toastie.  Would recommend stopping in here if you are in the area and looking for a nice meal with reasonable pricing.

BYnirvmZyWwR50RN7x9m-A.text: We stumbled upon Bella Italia after emerging from the underground ghost tour! It was 10:30pm and we were starving and this seemed to be the closest place on the Royal Mile that was still open! It fit all of our criteria so in we went for it. We had not realized that this was a chain, so the food is that more impressive. I can't say that I've dined at many chains and had really delicious food. The menu was pretty extensive, from numerous pasta bowls to the selection of pizza, there was something for everyone and the prices were pretty reasonable, so that was another selling point.  Our waiter was really nice, and made great recommendations, albeit the service was a tad slow. We started off with the Mozzarella Pomodoro which came out crispy and fluffy. I had the Agnello Tagliatelle, which was a heaping bowl of pasta and they didn't go light on the lamb either, the flavors were great, a very rich dish. I was starving and by the end of the meal, it didn't even look like I made a dent in the plate at all!  My husband had the Carne Mista pizza and raved about it being one of the better pizzas he's had in a while. The restaurant was very intimate at that time of night and the people watching was fantastic, it really added some interesting entertainment for the night. There was a taxi stand across the street so it was very easy to get back to our hotel afterwards.  We were pleasantly surprised with our random pick, we were weary that it would be a tourist trap, it probably was, but we really had a great time, it was well past midnight when we left and never once felt rushed despite the hour of the night.

0rEX2r1fpkNF11P9wtCOdA.text: Convenient on the Royal Mile and South Bridge junction. Was to be honest expecting a rip off but was pleasantly surprised . We had three courses for less than 50 . what's more the food was pretty good and the service was even better . The place however does get a lot of customers and is a little cramped but get there early and it will be good .

CHLleuIoFKowbCyj6_HsXg.text: Oh no, no, no.  THAT is not how Italian food is done. How would I know? Oh, I don't know, perhaps my many years of holidaying in Italy itself for months on end, perhaps my many, many Italian friends who have taught me over the years how to make a proper pasta, perhaps the fact that I have functioning taste-buds. Something which the kitchen-staff here seems to be lacking.  The service: we ordered, and the waiter was rude to the point of snatching, not taking the menus away from us. When out choices arrived and he tried to get the attention of one of our friends to alert her that her dish had arrived, he yelled, -no really he YELLED- "OI CALZONE!" at her. Conversation stopped dead, we all stared. The tables next to us stared. Rudest waiter experience I've ever had, in my life. And I've been to Paris multiple times so that's saying quite a lot. For the duration of the night he was extremely embarrassed, but suffice to say that we didn't leave a tip.  The food: ugh. Ugh, ugh, ugh. When you look at the food and think: "Should've gone to Domino's.." you know it's bad. I had the Calimari, ... I think? It tasted like deep-fried breadcrumbs with croutons inside of them instead of calimari. Next to it was a greasy, uninspired, over-salted sauce which should've come with fish 'n chips instead of a dainty starter.   And the thing that pisses me off the most is that I paid 5.85 for the privilege of getting my taste buds assaulted, yelled at by a waiter, and ogled by the rest of the (male) staff in a manner which was so insulting, I'll not repeat it here.  Oh, and did I mention that our jug of water contained half a chopped at lemon (you know the one you find behind at the back of your fridge, all dried up, that one) AND a piece of wax. Yes, there was a large piece of candle-wax in my glass of water.  Jum.  Steer clear, do NOT come here!

JLoTy6jS2eXz8vg9VceXSg.text: Classic Italian chain food. Not great, in fact pretty tasteless and overpriced, but it comes with super snappy service. Seriously, at 2 stars on the royal mile this might in fact be one of your best bets. But if you're feeling smart, get in a cab and head as far away from here as you can. Head to Newington Rd, Dalkeith Rd, Brougham St, and you'll find great places to eat.   Start walking away.

07GThnuH5rZj3FzwRKRSxw.text: Really good! I ordered a pizza with pepperoni and olives and it was much better than the pizza I get in America.

oMnJfS0kSpjHp1c9GSx0fw.text: Bella Italia is a series of Italian restaurants which are open up and down the country.  This one is situated on the Royal Mile and so is certainly targetting the tourists.  As a result, none of it is particularly cheap and most mains cost 10 or more, especially if you go for the seafood.   I came here with some friends a few months ago.  Although the food was good, you can definitely find better in the locality for far cheaper.  The menu has a good range of authentic Italian dishes and I went for the penne with chicken in a roasted pepper and wine sauce.   Our food took a while to arrive, but when it did it was served in decent portions and tasted pretty good. Bella Itali has some nice food on offer, but you'll probably go away expecting more for your money.

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

I805TRrKYdk0VGROONNbPA.text: Our Waitresses Ruth was absolutely fantastic! The food was delicious, and came out in a timely manner. This place was very busy, but again everything was perfect. Dessert was super yummy!  We will be back!!!!

67PtZhuN4rPr5qQKwgaN8w.text: I really can't begin to convey how pitiful this business is and our waiter in particular (Dan or Man the man as he says... over and over)   The Waiter Let's start with what I seriously believe to be unstable hazard to patrons. He berated my table and others with a pseudo Italian accent and even sexually harassed one of our tables females calling her his "ex girlfriend" to his other wait staff at an attempt at a joke. Our order which was forgotten about until we complained 1 and a half hours later! was awful to says the least. When we complained about the time it was taking to get our orders after 3 surrounding tables of similar meals were all served what did "Dan the Man" do? He argued and berated me and my table for 10min! Until the manager had to get involved. Saying it takes a long time to cook food and that it was our fault for ordering appetizers? Then when we did get our food one order was wrong and how long did it take to cook their made to order pizza? 7min this time! So what happened last time Dan? Why did it take so long? I can't understand how in this day in age someone like him is employed and allowed to harass and argue with customers like that.   The food If it was simply a bad waiter I would have conceded and gave this place more stars, however the food was equally as bad on all orders! The pizza's of which we ordered three were all burnt, thin, stiff, and lacking any cheeses or sauce. This is some of the toughest, most cardboard like pizza I have ever tasted in my life. I don't think it is made to order and I dont think they have competent kitchen staff either frankly. The speciality pizza's were lacking ingredients and using sub par quality ingredients. Everyone at my table noted how downright absurd the quality was here. I can't understand how this place has a licence to operate.   Overall  Avoid this place at all costs. It has a nice interior and location, thats about all it has going for it. The wait time is long, other reviews mention similar issues, it has from what I can tel now a track history with downright appalling customer service and food quality. They leech on tourists that are unsuspecting looking for the first place that looks nice to eat at and scam them of money with awful food and an unstable staff. Please mind this warning and don't risk it, there are a plethora of other more highly rated places to eat than this abomination.

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. &#34;Calamari&#34; that is so lacking, they just smothered it in breading hardly meat
Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The worst pasta
Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pitiful burnt and lacking pizza

uIKOhkm_H_DN6am-OStEmg.text: Really enjoyed our dinner here one night. The level of service here is amazing. Every single staff member was extremely friendly and welcoming throughout our whole time here. At one point while eating our meals my coat had fallen off the back of my chair and a waiter noticed and put it back on my chair which was such a lovely gesture and left me really impressed. The food here was amazing! I got the Pollo a la Crema which was full of flavour and for desert I got the Cookie Dough which was superb. Would recommend here to anyone as it was top of my list of places to eat in Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cookie Dough
Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pollo a la Crema

bxxqi21vO-FQZSwFV2eeEQ.text: I went to Bella Italia for lunch and the food was great! We tried a dessert sampler which was also amazing! A few days later after dinner went group and I were looking for dessert and thought we would stop in. They made us wait 20 minutes for a table which isn't a problem because there is six of us and it is a busy time and a smaller location. However, once our waiter comes over to us he kicks us out and informs us it is not worth it for him to serve us just dessert. He was extremely rude and could have handled the situation much better. He embarrassed us and handled the situation very unprofessionally. Sorry but get off your high horse this is not a 5 star Italian restaurant, you don't have the clout to act like this. I will not be returning.

jrYm5ONcVmgw3AxXrRcbrg.text: I went with a group of 6 and we waited 20 minutes for a table, which was okay. When we finally got seated, our waiter came to take our order. When we said that we'd just be ordering desserts, we were then told by the waiter that this "wasn't a coffee shop" and then told us that we were "honestly not worth holding a table for"; we immediately left afterwards. This waiter gave us the rudest customer service we have ever experienced, as we were willing to spend money there. I will not be returning and I do not think Bella Italia is worth the trip OR money.

88vX432W_ZzPfPrAVlxZkw.text: Kuba is the best waiter. Not only friendly but also very patient. We enjoy the food and his excellent service.

c_Jd7zKXlclruCnst_mL1g.text: I hate reviews about poor service that take off more than a star.  We received wonderful service at a peak dinner time and with a very busy kitchen.  We had a reasonably priced bottle of chianti and calamari appetizers.  Both were excellent.  Again, the restaraunt was packed and we felt that they produced our meal effortlessly.  The pasta prices were very reasonable and the food was prepared with imagination and color. This is a good choice for Italian in a non-pretenscious establishment.

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Amanda gives the Calmari 5 stars!

PUu5D2BEWzivdr3hAYeBew.text: We were on our last day in Edinburgh and wanted to grab a quick bite before leaving. Bella was right across from the Hilton. It was convenient so we stopped in. The food was average Italian. If you are looking for typical "shopping mall food court" food, this is your place.

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Margarita pizza

NjeADHeIXaDn8RSxZqNcTA.text: Possibly the worst place to eat on the Royal Mile. Service was markedly subpar. Long wait with open tables available, then was usurped by a group of 5 that came in behind my partner and me. Such a shame because there are so many other wonderful places to eat within a short distance.

TgtcrHr6reYyQilm93ri4Q.text: The hours listed on their website state the restaurant opens at 9:00. They have - what looks like a great breakfast deal so I was wanting to go here and try it. I went three times all after 9:00 - between 9:00 and 10:00 and they were never open. Staff would just give me blank looks as I tried the locked doors. Come on, guys. At least update your hours online if you've changed them.

LxxjJiPv7o5D3Z3-bK_Oew.text: Walked in after looking for food on a Sunday evening around 9 pm when most places were closed or closing. The restaurant had a nice atmosphere and the staff were very friendly. We ordered a calzone and the pollo lasagna. Both dishes were great. The calzone was huge with a great tomato sauce and flaky crust, while the pollo lasagna was thin, but had a great cheese sauce along with grilled chicken and pancetta. Overall positive experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The huge calzone and the pollo lasagna
Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The pollo lasagna- very good!

s3xyNNKqpqyVQRzDt7w2eg.text: Spaghetti bolognaise was excellent. Restaurant is nice looking. Pizza Margherita was very good, but the spaghetti was amazing. Pasta is made in Italy. Wait staff was very charming. We did not get dessert this time, which is unusual for us.

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Amazing spaghetti with meat sauce
Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Pizza
Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Very nice

PD86t99H-m1mBZuG58bnmA.text: This restaurant on the outside look pretty but the service is ridiculous.  I went in to the restaurant and the manage told me first come first serve and wait 15. I told him I understand it. Few minutes late, he asked the people form behind me go to the table before me. What does he mean first come first serve? ..  Fine, I waited for another 10 minutes.  After, I walked and he told me "You have one hour for you table." Should I bring a timer to your restaurant next time?"   Food and service are pretty good.

UQ9sUf8ueKIs30MH8rR9RQ.text: Great food in general.  We ate here a few times while in Edinburgh.  It was around the corner from our hotel and easy to find seating during busy evenings when we didn't make reservations.  Their pizza was so good.  It had the right amount of sauce and cheese with the perfect amount of crunch to the crust.  I have to say I was very glad I found this place our second day of visiting. We were greeted and seated pretty quickly and our waiter was actually our waiter each time we visited, but I think that was just a fluke.  LOL.  He was spot on.  We didn't have to ask for anything for the most part.  He was there and refilling glasses, taking orders, and bringing napkins. If you are near the Royal Mile, stop in.  I am sure you will not regret it.

5In3w6qXcIbXvr_osvspZw.text: Well,Italy was found at this busy restaurant.Meats from one Italian family,pasta from another,what deliciousness.The Mozarella Carozza with chili sauce,was to die for.My Limoncello spritzer was refreshing,and our CarnaMista pizza was a pleasure for these American taste buds.All of these were served with a smile by our waitress Ingrida......she truly loves her job.The manager bused tables,served food ,made drinks,and was truly doing a great job on a restaurant filled with tourists.

HlAnkxDAHGnA-1uxrV4tyg.text: I've been living in Edinburgh for months now and this is the worst customer experience I've ever had here. The waiter was condescending and simple rude. I saw the table next to us complain about him as well. We felt forgotten and left unsatisfied. Will not be returning.

XN3BlQ6dJBThC4z-XpeB-Q.text: I had the worst pizza in the UK here. I have been travelling in UK for 2 months. If you "create your own pizza, the base is supposed to be the Margarita pizza plus 2 more ingredients. I got a burnt pizza with no tomatoes or basil and limited burnt red onions and sad olives. Don't eat here.

Mt6kwQIozSnWBtC6SPTWDQ.text: We went here for dinner on Boxing Day, and I'm really glad we did. All of the waiters were so friendly and we talked to them for a long time. My pasta was a lacking a little in seasoning, but the pizza bread with caramelized onions and mozzarella was amazing! I recreated it as soon as I got back home to the US.

ZhrSaGxRaLPyFjyA0OF76A.text: Ok so, this is not an authentic Italian. It doesn't try to be. This is a chain of restaurants that provides a decent quality restaurant food Italian Style.. It is not for a formal occasion.  We arrived pretty ravenous after a swim and wanted somewhere to sit and something to fill our bellies with.   On arrival we were greeted and invited to anywhere we'd fancied.  The table was bare save napkins and cutlery. Our waitress provided the menus.  We took wine and I had a pasta with prawns and chilli. Lovely.   Now for the best part: they have just recently introduced "mini desserts" - Yes sir.  You can order 3 or 5 desserts and they come in shot glasses - pannacotta, banana toffee (Banoffee), tiramisu, cheesecake and a deep chocolate ganache like thingy.  Brilliant for sharing and this was simply wonderful in execution and taste.   if you want authentic Italian, go to an authentic Italian.  When you want good simple tasty pasta dishes and nice dessert selection? Go to Bella Italia.

photos.caption: Photo of Bella Italia - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Welkom window

ahZprMNlstfWfRhwonskrA.text: A group of 6 with 2 kids, we asked for a table and the host offered 2 tables of 4, separated by one other. We kindly asked the couple on the table in between to switch so we would be able to sit in adjacent tables. They were very kind to agree. However, the host, in a very rude manner, told us we could not switch because "This is my restaurant and I decide". What was he thinking? I can not believe the arrogance of this person!!!
